Jarreau Campbell

Weight 185

Class Junior

Hometown Bloomfield Hills, Mich.

Highschool Brother Rice

Bio

Related

Stats

Historical

Biography

2022 (Junior): Went 12-10 overall in singles action with a perfect 6-0 mark in duals … Picked up wins at No. 1, 2, 3 and 6 singles and went 2-0 at No. 5 … Was 7-3 in his last ten matches … Compiled a 3-1 record with Nick Williams in doubles play and was 2-7 overall as a doubles partner in the spring … 1-4 in doubles with Graydon Lair ... Academic All-Big Ten.

2020-21 (Sophomore): Competed at No. 5 and 6 singles as well as all three doubles courts in spring 2021 … Owned a 5-8 doubles record and went 4-6 in conference play … Played two matches at No. 1 doubles, going 1-1 … Went 2-5 at No. 2 and 2-2 at No. 3 doubles, both with teammate Graydon Lair … Academic All-Big Ten.

2019-20 (Freshman): Finished the season 6-17 overall and 3-6 in duals . . . competed in flights four, five and six in singles . . . went 3-2 on court six with wins over Niagara, Western Michigan and Drake . . . finished 4-5 in doubles action with partner Drew Keene . . . went 3-3 on court two and 1-2 in the first flight . . . competed in four fall tournaments for the Spartans . . . grabbed two singles wins at the Western Michigan Invite and a singles win at the Bayliss Invite in South Bend, Indiana.

High School

Attended Brother Rice High School in Bloomfield Hills, Michigan . . . lettered all four years . . . was elected team captain his senior season . . . earned all-state honors and collected doubles state championship competing in the No. 1 spot.

Personal

Born March 30, 2001 . . . son of Steve and Tracey Campbell . . . father was an All-American tennis player at Rice University who reached third round in singles play at 1998 Australian Open..
